channel.title: eWEEK Technology News
channel.description: Latest technology news from Ziff Davis, featuring stories from eWEEK, ExtremeTech and PC Magazine
channel.copyright: Copyright 2004 Ziff Davis Media Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Oracle May Drop Its PeopleSoft Bid Lower
item.description: Oracle Corp. co-president Safra Catz says weakness in Peoplesoft Inc. business operations may prompt her company to cut its buyout offer by one-third to one-fourth.

item.title: ADV: FREE WHITE PAPER: Search and the Strategic Value to the Enterprise
item.description: It’s impossible to tell how often your employees can’t find the information they need from your corporate Intranet. However, a recent study found that on average, 25% of an employees’ workday is spent looking for information. This white paper looks at some trends employees use to get the information they need, and explains what you can do to help them.

item.title: HP's Printing Group Stresses Services
item.description: Imaging and printing group plans to emphasize services.

item.title: Wi-Fi Alliance Cracks Down On Pre-Standard Products
item.description: The Wi-Fi Alliance on Monday drew a line in the sand for so-called "pre-standard products," stating that it would not certify early 802.11n products before the standard was certified by the IEEE standards body.

item.title: Will Election Decide Broadband?
item.description: Washington pundits are digging deep into party ideologies to gauge the upcoming election's potential effect on technology industries.

item.title: SunGard Spinning Off Availability Services
item.description: SunGard is spinning off its Availability Services business as a stand-alone public company.

item.title: Microsoft Streamlines Project Tasks
item.description: Microsoft enhances Solomon 6.0 with capabilities that should help users better manage projects through a more unified environment.

item.title: PeopleSoft May Entertain Offers
item.description: PeopleSoft Director says the company is willing to talk to suitors—if the price is right.

item.title: BMC Preps Integration Pair
item.description: Tools to simplify mainframe control.

item.title: Cyber-Security Chief Resignation Spotlights DHS Woes
item.description: Yoran's departure raises new—and old—cyber-security concerns.

item.title: Multiband Wi-Fi Device Manages Voice, Video and Data
item.description: Symbol's 'access port' will support 802.11a, b and g simultaneously.

item.title: HP, NetApp Build NAS-to-SAN Links
item.description: HP and NetApp enable storage silos to connect with one another.

item.title: Third Parties Fill 'Longhorn' Void
item.description: Infragistics, Compuware and Borland support features Microsoft has delayed.

item.title: HP, IBM Bundles Target SMBs
item.description: HP is working with software makers to create bundles of their most popular small- and midsize-business applications preinstalled on HP systems, while IBM is bringing its Power 5 design to the SMB segment through its Express architecture.

item.title: Network Gear to Speed Up Broadband Services
item.description: Vendors compete with high-availability telecom services.

item.title: Mainframes Make Their Comeback
item.description: The Big Iron is back, as mainframe sales grow at IBM and Unisys, and other companies offer new tools for linking legacy systems and commodity servers.

item.title: E-tailer Passes Stress Test
item.description: Segue Software's SilkPerformer application keeps traffic overload from taking down apparel retailer BlueFly's e-commerce site.

item.title: POS Printing Rings True for Cingular
item.description: Cingular fixes its customer service problem by providing the right data at the point of sale.

item.title: PacSun Stays Atop the Swell of Data
item.description: Tivoli keeps PacSun from drowning in rising tide of data.

item.title: AMD Blocked From Intel Documents in Antitrust Case
item.description: A federal judge has refused a request by chip maker AMD to order its rival Intel to turn over company documents to the European Commission.
